author: Debra Killalea
title: Is Australia Racist? on SBS: Woman will restore your faith in humanity
text:
THIS is the moment a woman stands up to another commuter on a busy train platform in footage captured by undercover cameras. 
Filmed as part of SBS documentary Is Australia Racist? , the situation was set up to test if Australians would say something if they saw someone being racially abused.
In the segment, which aired last night, actor Anna Philps can be seen waiting for a train.
It’s not long before she is noticed by another woman on the station who asks her if she has been in a refugee camp like Nauru.
Actor Anna Philp stands on the station when she is asked this question by a fellow commuter. Picture: SBS Source: SBS 
The woman, who is also an actor, was testing if any bystanders would stand up for Anna.
Most did nothing, but the incident didn’t go unnoticed by one woman sitting nearby who quickly jumped to Anna’s defence.
“Excuse me, are you bullying this girl?” she asks.
The girl replies she was just asking a question but the woman was having none of it, insisting she was asking “absolutely outrageous questions”.
“If you are Australian, I am disgusted, disgusted in what I’ve just heard you say,” she tells the girl.
The shocking scene was one of several undercover experiments filmed as part of last night’s show. The documentary, hosted by Ray Martin, has generated fierce debate on social media, with many commending the woman’s actions.
“This is (a) real Aussie, hats off to this wonderful lady,” one Facebook user posted. “I think Australia should be proud … that we have many wonderful people in our country.”
Another posted that it was great to see the woman’s response to such an outrageous question, while others said racism was everywhere.
But it wasn’t the only confronting moment in the show.
Rahila is shocked as the man confronts her in front of several people. Picture: SBS Source: SBS 
In another scene, SBS volunteer and Afghan-born Rahila Haidary was shown being racially abused by a man in a busy Perth shopping mall. 
The man asks why she didn’t show her face and dress like other Australians.
